markdownRemark.html:
Introduction

Rich Hicky gave an insightful talk on the role of type. He presents incisive commentary on the use of exhaustive typing enforced (and praised) by languages like Haskell. A part of the issue strict typing reveals, as he outlines for us, is that programming at a high-level is the process of automating tasks and procedures that exist in a domain.

Programs excel at automating repetitive tasks. With the advent of more advanced techniques such as Machine Learning we see computers automating fuzzy, high-level tasks. On the spectrum from simple to sophisticated we may have “add these two numbers together” vs “recognise this person in this crowd of faces”. The thing both of these tasks have in common is that they exist within a specific problem space.

In a sense, programs can now create programs. Whatever the level of sophistication, programs still operate inside domains.
